column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

Blackall Agents yarded 4,430 head for their regular monthly  weaner sale. All the regular processors feedlotters and backgrounders present and active. The market improved for the better quality lines.

Light weight yearling steers under 200kg topped 368c/kg. Yearling steers 200 to 280kg sold from 300c to 424c/kg for the better lines. Yearling steers 280 to 330kg also selling to 424c/kg to restockers.Yearling steers 330 to 400kg improved in price and sold from 222c to 378c/kg. Yearling steers 400 to 480kg with the majority making to 362c to average 348c/kg. 

Light weight Yearling heifers under 200kg with the C muscle selling from 224c to 248c/kg. Yearling heifers 200 to 280kg with the majority selling to 306c/kg. Yearling heifers 280 to 330kg also sold to dearer trend and sold from 230c to 364c/kg. Yearling heifers 330 to 400kg also improved in price and made 298c to restockers and 298c/kg to feed. Yearling heifers 400 to 480kg sold to 50c/kg dearer and made to 300c/kg to feed.

With limited numbers in the heavy steer categories selling from 228c to 312c to feed and 300c/kg over 600kg to processors. Grown heifers over 540kg made from 242c to 286c/kg to processors. Also limited number of cows penned but 3 scores over 520kg topped 270c/kg to processors. Heavy bulls over 600kg sold to 270c with bulls under 450c/kg  made to 334c/kg.

Market Reporter David Friend
